title: Job Vacancies at Arion Energy Services Limited
content:
Arion Energy Services Limited is an engineering, projects and operations services provider to the oil and gas, power and maritime industries. We are an agile and innovative company providing reliable solutions through our Adapt, Innovate and Resolve (AIR) approach to service delivery. We believe in developing exceptional teams to Adapt our services and tools to meet clients’ needs, Innovate solutions around project requirements and Resolve challenges to deliver expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) People Advisor

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Support recruitment activities 
	Conduct interviews, and make offers.
	Verify employee records and claims.
	Handle onboarding and new hire orientations.
	Assist in developing and implementing HR policies, performance management, engagement, and talent development programs.
	Support payroll processing 
	Manage employee documentation
	Monitor compliance with HR policies, SOPs, and labor laws.
	Provide advice tmanagers and staff on HR policies and best practices.
	Administer employee lifecycle processes
	Support employee benefit programs and wellness initiatives.
	Maintain HR data accuracy and prepare documentation for audits.
	Contribute tHR projects that boost engagement and organizational effectiveness.
	Handle employee relations issues and conflict resolution.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in HR, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of relevant HR experience.
	Recognized HR certification (e.g., CIPM) is preferred.
	Strong understanding of HR functions, employment laws, and best practices.
	Effective communicator, both written and verbal.
	Proficiency in HRIS systems and MS Office Suite.


Method of Application
Intrested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@arionenergyservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Learning and Development (L&D) Coordinator 

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Conduct training needs assessments tidentify skill gaps and development opportunities.
	Develop, organize, and facilitate training programs, workshops, and seminars for staff and clients.
	Coordinate logistics for training sessions
	Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs 
	Collaborate with department managers tunderstand current and future training needs.
	Other duties as may be required.


Requirements


	Degree in HR, Education, or related fields
	4 - 7 years of experience in training and development, preferably in Oil & Gas / Marine sectors
	Ability tassess training needs and evaluate training effectiveness.
	Certification in Training and Development is a plus.
	Experience with e-learning platforms and digital training tools.


Method of Application
Intrested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@arionenergyservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Recruiter

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos

What You’ll Do


	Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies.
	Source candidates.
	Conduct interviews.
	Collaborate with hiring managers tdefine job requirements and create JD.
	Conduct verifications & background checks.
	Assist with other duties as assigned.


Key Qualifications


	Degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related field.
	3 - 5 years of recruiting experience, preferably in Oil & Gas / Marine sectors.
	Strong knowledge of recruitment processes and ATS systems.


Method of Application
Intrested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@arionenergyservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Digital Virgo is a global leader in mobile payment and monetization through direct carrier billing (DCB). We operate in over 40 countries and partner with telecom operators and merchants to deploy high-impact payment and content services. Our Technical Project Managers ensure local project success by aligning business objectives with technical execution

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Technical Project Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Festac Town, Lagos
Employment time: Full-time

Job Description


	The Technical Project Manager will lead local and regional integrations with telecom operators and merchants.
	He will be responsible for validating flows and APIs, coordinating technical setups, ensuring test coverage, and delivering operational documentation.
	The role requires strong communication and autonomy to operate effectively with partners, including the ability to build local trust, overcome cultural barriers, and intervene physically or by phone when necessary to resolve issues.


Qualifications


	Validate availability and completeness of flows and API endpoints (charging, cancellation, invoice, etc.)
	Draft, maintain and share clear technical documentation including starter kits and flow diagrams
	Coordinate local environment setup (VPN, IP whitelisting, SMPP&hellip;)
	Prepare and follow execution of testbooks with internal teams and external partners
	Validate technical &amp; functional tests
	Support debugging and identify technical gaps during integration
	Ensure documentation is centralized and regularly updated in Jira, Sharepoint&hellip;
	Track progress and communicate blockers clearly with internal and external teams
	Work closely with DV teams (Business, Technical teams, Product&hellip;) and local partners
	Support Product team on product launch testing and debugging


Required Profile


	Minimum 5 years of experience in technical missions (development, network, telecom) and then in Project Management
	Familiar with API testing and debugging (Postman, Swagger, logs, REST, JSON)
	Ability to read and interpret technical documentation
	Familiarity with project tools (MS Project, Jira, Excel)
	Proficient in English (spoken and written); French is a plus
	Knowledge of telecom environments: SMS/USSD flows, DCB, SMPP, OTP is a plus
	Comfortable making direct contact with partners (calls, onsite if needed) to resolve blocking points
	Understanding of regional context and ability to interact with local stakeholders effectively


Soft Skills:


	Autonomous, structured and dependable under pressure
	Strong communication skills, with the ability to navigate multi-stakeholder contexts
	Capable of escalating and pushing for priorities when needed
	Problem-solving mindset and ability to propose viable workarounds
	Culturally aware, able to adapt to local environments and build trust quickly
	Open to occasional travel when project delivery requires physical presence

Technical Project Manager Job at Digital Virgo Group




        
    

        
        Digital Virgo is a global leader in mobile payment and monetization through direct carrier billing (DCB). We operate in over 40 countries and partner with telecom operators and merchants to deploy high-impact payment and content services. Our Technical Project Managers ensure local project success by aligning business objectives with technical execution

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Project Manager

Job Location: Festac Town, Lagos
Employment time: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Technical Project Manager will lead local and regional integrations with telecom operators and merchants.
	He will be responsible for validating flows and APIs, coordinating technical setups, ensuring test coverage, and delivering operational documentation.
	The role requires strong communication and autonomy to operate effectively with partners, including the ability to build local trust, overcome cultural barriers, and intervene physically or by phone when necessary to resolve issues.


Qualifications


	Validate availability and completeness of flows and API endpoints (charging, cancellation, invoice, etc.)
	Draft, maintain and share clear technical documentation including starter kits and flow diagrams
	Coordinate local environment setup (VPN, IP whitelisting, SMPP…)
	Prepare and follow execution of testbooks with internal teams and external partners
	Validate technical & functional tests
	Support debugging and identify technical gaps during integration
	Ensure documentation is centralized and regularly updated in Jira, Sharepoint…
	Track progress and communicate blockers clearly with internal and external teams
	Work closely with DV teams (Business, Technical teams, Product…) and local partners
	Support Product team on product launch testing and debugging


Required Profile


	Minimum 5 years of experience in technical missions (development, network, telecom) and then in Project Management
	Familiar with API testing and debugging (Postman, Swagger, logs, REST, JSON)
	Ability to read and interpret technical documentation
	Familiarity with project tools (MS Project, Jira, Excel)
	Proficient in English (spoken and written); French is a plus
	Knowledge of telecom environments: SMS/USSD flows, DCB, SMPP, OTP is a plus
	Comfortable making direct contact with partners (calls, onsite if needed) to resolve blocking points
	Understanding of regional context and ability to interact with local stakeholders effectively


Soft Skills:


	Autonomous, structured and dependable under pressure
	Strong communication skills, with the ability to navigate multi-stakeholder contexts
	Capable of escalating and pushing for priorities when needed
	Problem-solving mindset and ability to propose viable workarounds
	Culturally aware, able to adapt to local environments and build trust quickly
	Open to occasional travel when project delivery requires physical presence
